./external/basejump_stl/bsg_misc/bsg_priority_encode.v Cov: 100% 

   1: // MBT 5-22-16
   2: //
   3: // Given a bit vector, return binary value
   4: // corresponding to first bit that is set, starting from the low bit.
   5: //
   6: // e.g.   0001 --> 0, v= 1
   7: //        0011 --> 0, v= 1
   8: //        0101 --> 0, v= 1
   9: //        0100 --> 2, v= 1
  10: //        0000 --> 0, v= 0
  11: //
  12: // with some updates to the bsg_encode_one_hot function,
  13: // should be able to support both directions
  14: //
  15: 
  16: module bsg_priority_encode #(parameter   width_p    = "inv"
  17:                              , parameter lo_to_hi_p = "inv"
  18:                              )
  19: 
  20:    (input    [width_p-1:0] i
  21:     , output [`BSG_SAFE_CLOG2(width_p)-1:0] addr_o
  22:     , output v_o
  23:     );
  24: 
  25:    logic [width_p-1:0] enc_lo;
  26: 
  27:    bsg_priority_encode_one_hot_out #(.width_p(width_p)
  28:                                      ,.lo_to_hi_p(lo_to_hi_p)
  29:                                      ) a
  30:      (.i(i)
  31:       ,.o(enc_lo)
  32:       );
  33: 
  34:    bsg_encode_one_hot #(.width_p(width_p)
  35:                         ,.lo_to_hi_p(lo_to_hi_p)
  36:                         ) b
  37:      (.i      (enc_lo)
  38:       ,.addr_o(addr_o)
  39:       ,.v_o   (v_o)
  40:       );
  41: 
  42: endmodule
  43:
